intro: Swertia volkensii var. baleensis, commonly known as the Bale Swertia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered with a fine layer of pubescence. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
